021import net.tnemc.core.EconomyManager;
022import net.tnemc.core.TNECore;
023import net.tnemc.core.account.Account;
024import net.tnemc.core.account.AccountStatus;
025import net.tnemc.core.account.NonPlayerAccount;
026import net.tnemc.core.account.PlayerAccount;
027import net.tnemc.core.account.SharedAccount;
028import net.tnemc.core.account.holdings.HoldingsEntry;
029import net.tnemc.core.account.holdings.HoldingsHandler;
030import net.tnemc.core.account.holdings.modify.HoldingsModifier;
031import net.tnemc.core.actions.ActionSource;
032import net.tnemc.core.actions.EconomyResponse;
033import net.tnemc.core.actions.source.PluginSource;
034import net.tnemc.core.api.response.AccountAPIResponse;
035import net.tnemc.core.currency.Currency;
036import net.tnemc.core.currency.CurrencyType;
037import net.tnemc.core.currency.format.CurrencyFormatter;
038import net.tnemc.core.currency.format.FormatRule;
039import net.tnemc.core.transaction.Transaction;
040import net.tnemc.core.transaction.TransactionResult;
041import net.tnemc.core.utils.exceptions.InvalidTransactionException;
042import net.tnemc.plugincore.PluginCore;
043import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.api.CallbackManager;
044import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
045
046import java.math.BigDecimal;
047import java.util.Collection;
048import java.util.Optional;
049import java.util.UUID;
050import java.util.function.Function;
051
052/**
053 * The core TNE API class.
054 *
055 * @author creatorfromhell
056 * @since 0.1.2.0
057 */
058public class TNEAPI {
059
060
061  /**
062   * The callback manager for the TNE API. This adds an event-style system that is supported across
063   * every platform.
064   *
065   * @return The callback manager that is being used.
066   */
067  public CallbackManager callbacks() {
068
069    return PluginCore.callbacks();
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Used to add a new {@link HoldingsHandler} to the {@link net.tnemc.core.EconomyManager}. These
074   * handlers are able to add additional holdings sources for accounts.
075   *
076   * @param handler The handler to add.
077   *
078   * @see <a href="https://github.com/TheNewEconomy/EconomyCore/wiki/API#holdings-handlers">Handlers
079   * Wiki</a>
080   */
081  public void addHandler(final HoldingsHandler handler) {
082
083    EconomyManager.instance().addHandler(handler);
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * Adds an account type represented by the specified class along with a validation function.
088   *
089   * @param type  The {@link Class} representing the account type, extending {@link SharedAccount}.
090   * @param check The validation function that takes a {@code String} argument and returns a
091   *              {@code Boolean}. It is used to check if an account of the specified type is valid
092   *              based on some criteria. The {@code String} argument is the account's name.
093   */
094  public void addAccountType(final Class<? extends SharedAccount> type, final Function<String, Boolean> check) {
095    //TODO: implement this.
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Adds an account status to the collection.
100   *
101   * @param status The {@code AccountStatus} to be added.
102   */
103  public void addAccountStatus(final AccountStatus status) {
104
105    TNECore.eco().account().addAccountStatus(status);
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Used to determine if an {@link Account} exists with the specified identifier.
110   * <p>
111   * This method is safe to search for non-player accounts.
112   *
113   * @param identifier The string identifier for the account that is being looked for.
114   *
115   * @return True if an account with the specified identifier exists, otherwise false.
116   *
117   * @since 0.1.2.0
118   */
119  public boolean hasAccount(@NotNull final String identifier) {
120
121    return TNECore.eco().account().findAccount(identifier).isPresent();
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * Used to determine if an {@link PlayerAccount} exists with the specified identifier.
126   * <p>
127   * This method is not safe to search for non-player accounts.
128   *
129   * @param identifier The {@link UUID identifier} for the account that is being looked for.
130   *
131   * @return True if an account with the specified identifier exists, otherwise false.
132   *
133   * @since 0.1.2.0
134   */
135  public boolean hasPlayerAccount(@NotNull final UUID identifier) {
136
137    return TNECore.eco().account().findAccount(identifier).isPresent();
138  }
139
140  /**
141   * Looks for an account based on the provided identifier and if none is found, creates it.
142   * <p>
143   * This method could return any of the following account types: - {@link NonPlayerAccount} -
144   * {@link SharedAccount}
145   * <p>
146   * This method is safe to search for non-player accounts.
147   *
148   * @param identifier The string identifier for the account that is being looked for.
149   * @param name       The string name for the account that is being looked for.
150   *
151   * @return The correlating {@link Account account} object if found, otherwise the one created.
152   *
153   * @since 0.1.2.0
154   */
155  public AccountAPIResponse getOrCreateAccount(@NotNull final String identifier, @NotNull final String name) {
156
157    final AccountAPIResponse response = TNECore.eco().account().createAccount(identifier, name);
158
159    return response;
160  }
161
162  /**
163   * Looks for an account based on the provided identifier and if none is found, creates it.
164   * <p>
165   * This method returns an {@link PlayerAccount}.
166   * <p>
167   * This method is not safe to search for non-player accounts.
168   *
169   * @param identifier The {@link UUID} identifier for the account that is being looked for.
170   * @param name       The string name for the account that is being looked for.
171   *
172   * @return The correlating {@link AccountAPIResponse response}.
173   *
174   * @since 0.1.2.0
175   */
176  public AccountAPIResponse getOrCreatePlayerAccount(@NotNull final UUID identifier, @NotNull final String name) {
177
178    return getOrCreateAccount(identifier.toString(), name);
179  }
180
181  /**
182   * Attempts to create an account with the given identifier. This method returns true if the
183   * account was created, otherwise false.
184   * <p>
185   * This method is intended for non-player accounts.
186   *
187   * @param identifier The String identifier for the account that is being created.
188   *
189   * @return If the account is created an Optional containing the {@link SharedAccount account}, or
190   * an empty Optional.
191   *
192   * @since 0.1.2.0
193   */
194  public Optional<SharedAccount> createNonPlayerAccount(@NotNull final String identifier, final String name) {
195
196    return TNECore.eco().account().createNonPlayerAccount(identifier, name);
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * Attempts to create an account with the given identifier. This method returns true if the
201   * account was created, otherwise false.
202   * <p>
203   * This method is not intended for non-player accounts.
204   *
205   * @param identifier The {@link UUID} identifier for the account that is being created.
206   * @param name       The String representation of the name for the account being created, usually
207   *                   the username of the player.
208   *
209   * @return The correlating {@link AccountAPIResponse response}.
210   *
211   * @since 0.1.2.0
212   */
213  public AccountAPIResponse createPlayerAccount(@NotNull final UUID identifier, @NotNull final String name) {
214
215    return TNECore.eco().account().createAccount(identifier.toString(), name);
216  }
217
218  /**
219   * Looks for an account based on the provided identifier.
220   * <p>
221   * This method could return any of the following account types: - {@link PlayerAccount} -
222   * {@link NonPlayerAccount} - {@link SharedAccount}
223   * <p>
224   * This method is safe to search for non-player accounts.
225   *
226   * @param identifier The string identifier for the account that is being looked for.
227   *
228   * @return An optional containing the {@link Account} if found, otherwise an empty optional.
229   *
230   * @since 0.1.2.0
231   */
232  public Optional<Account> getAccount(@NotNull final String identifier) {
233
234    return TNECore.eco().account().findAccount(identifier);
235  }
236
237  /**
238   * Looks for an {@link PlayerAccount} based on the provided {@link UUID identifier}.
239   * <p>
240   * This method is not safe to search for non-player accounts.
241   *
242   * @param identifier The {@link UUID identifier} for the account that is being looked for.
243   *
244   * @return An optional containing the {@link PlayerAccount} if found, otherwise an empty optional.
245   *
246   * @since 0.1.2.0
247   */
248  public Optional<PlayerAccount> getPlayerAccount(@NotNull final UUID identifier) {
249
250    return TNECore.eco().account().findPlayerAccount(identifier);
251  }
252
253  /**
254   * Used to delete the specified account.
255   * <p>
256   * This method is safe to search for non-player accounts.
257   *
258   * @param identifier The identifier associated with the account that you wish to delete.
259   * @param source     The {@link ActionSource source} response for this deletion call.
260   *
261   * @return The {@link EconomyResponse response} that should be returned based on the deletion
262   * action.
263   *
264   * @since 0.1.2.0
265   */
266  public EconomyResponse deleteAccount(@NotNull final String identifier, @NotNull final ActionSource source) {
267
268    return TNECore.eco().account().deleteAccount(identifier);
269  }
270
271  /**
272   * Used to delete the specified account.
273   * <p>
274   * This method is not safe to search for non-player accounts.
275   *
276   * @param identifier The identifier associated with the account that you wish to delete.
277   * @param source     The {@link ActionSource source} response for this deletion call.
278   *
279   * @return The {@link EconomyResponse response} that should be returned based on the deletion
280   * action.
281   *
282   * @since 0.1.2.0
283   **/
284  public EconomyResponse deleteAccount(@NotNull final UUID identifier, @NotNull final ActionSource source) {
285
286    return TNECore.eco().account().deleteAccount(identifier);
287  }
288
289  /**
290   * Adds a {@link CurrencyType} to the collection.
291   *
292   * @param type The {@link CurrencyType} to be added.
293   */
294  public void addCurrencyType(final CurrencyType type) {
295
296    TNECore.eco().currency().addType(type);
297  }
298
299  /**
300   * Adds a {@link Currency} to the collection.
301   *
302   * @param currency The {@link Currency} to be added.
303   */
304  public void addCurrency(final Currency currency) {
305
306    TNECore.eco().currency().addCurrency(currency);
307  }
308
309  /**
310   * Adds a {@link FormatRule} for balance formatting.
311   *
312   * @param rule The {@link FormatRule} to be added for balance formatting.
313   */
314  public void addBalanceFormatRule(final FormatRule rule) {
315
316    CurrencyFormatter.addRule(rule);
317  }
318
319  /**
320   * Used to get the default currency. This could be the default currency for the server globally or
321   * for the default world if the implementation supports multi-world.
322   *
323   * @return The currency that is the default for the server if multi-world support is not available
324   * otherwise the default for the default world.
325   *
326   * @since 0.1.2.0
327   */
328  public @NotNull Currency getDefaultCurrency() {
329
330    return TNECore.api().getDefaultCurrency();
331  }
332
333  /**
334   * Used to get the default currency for the specified world if this implementation has multi-world
335   * support, otherwise the default currency for the server.
336   *
337   * @param region The region to get the default currency for. This could be a world, biomes, or a
338   *               third party based region.
339   *
340   * @return The default currency for the specified world if this implementation has multi-world
341   * support, otherwise the default currency for the server.
342   *
343   * @since 0.1.2.0
344   */
345  public @NotNull Currency getDefaultCurrency(@NotNull final String region) {
346
347    return TNECore.eco().currency().defaultCurrency(region);
348  }
349
350  /**
351   * Used to get a set of every  {@link Currency} object for the server.
352   *
353   * @return A set of every {@link Currency} object that is available for the server.
354   *
355   * @since 0.1.2.0
356   */
357  public Collection<Currency> getCurrencies() {
358
359    return TNECore.eco().currency().currencies();
360  }
361
362  /**
363   * Used to get a set of every {@link Currency} object that is available in the specified world if
364   * this implementation has multi-world support, otherwise all {@link Currency} objects for the
365   * server.
366   *
367   * @param region The region to get the currencies for. This could be a world, biomes, or a third
368   *               party based region.
369   *
370   * @return A set of every {@link Currency} object that is available in the specified world if this
371   * implementation has multi-world support, otherwise all {@link Currency} objects for the server.
372   *
373   * @since 0.1.2.0
374   */
375  public Collection<Currency> getCurrencies(@NotNull final String region) {
376
377    return TNECore.api().getCurrencies(region);
378  }
379
380  /**
381   * Used to get the holdings of the specified identifier.
382   *
383   * @param identifier The identifier to get the holdings for.
384   * @param world      The world to use for getting the holdings.
385   * @param currency   The currency to use for getting the holdings
386   *
387   * @return The holdings in {@link BigDecimal} format.
388   */
389  public BigDecimal getHoldings(final String identifier, final String world, final String currency) {
390
391    final Optional<Account> account = TNECore.eco().account().findAccount(identifier);
392    final Optional<Currency> currency1 = TNECore.eco().currency().find(currency);
393
394    if(account.isPresent() && currency1.isPresent()) {
395      return account.get().getHoldingsTotal(world, currency1.get().getUid());
396    }
397    return BigDecimal.ZERO;
398  }
399
400  /**
401   * Used to check if a specific identifier has an amount of holdings.
402   *
403   * @param identifier The identifier to check the holdings for.
404   * @param world      The world to use for the holdings check.
405   * @param currency   The currency to use for the holdings check.
406   * @param amount     The {@link BigDecimal} amount that we need to check if the identifier has.
407   *
408   * @return True if the specified identifier has the holdings, otherwise false.
409   */
410  public boolean hasHoldings(final String identifier, final String world, final String currency, final BigDecimal amount) {
411
412    return getHoldings(identifier, world, currency).compareTo(amount) >= 0;
413  }
414
415  /**
416   * Used to remove a certain amount of holdings from an identifier.
417   *
418   * @param identifier The identifier to use for the transaction.
419   * @param world      The world to use for the transaction.
420   * @param currency   The currency to use for the transaction.
421   * @param amount     The amount to remove.
422   * @param pluginName The name of the plugin performing this transaction.
423   *
424   * @return The associated {@link TransactionResult result} from the transaction.
425   */
426  public TransactionResult removeHoldings(final String identifier, final String world, final String currency, final BigDecimal amount, final String pluginName) {
427
428    final Optional<Account> account = TNECore.eco().account().findAccount(identifier);
429    final Optional<Currency> currencyObject = TNECore.eco().currency().find(currency);
430
431    if(account.isPresent() && currencyObject.isPresent()) {
432
433      final HoldingsModifier modifier = new HoldingsModifier(world,
434                                                             currencyObject.get().getUid(),
435                                                             amount);
436
437      final Transaction transaction = new Transaction("take")
438              .to(account.get(), modifier)
439              .source(new PluginSource(pluginName));
440      try {
441
442        return transaction.process();
443
444      } catch(final InvalidTransactionException e) {
445        return new TransactionResult(false, e.getMessage());
446      }
447    }
448    return new TransactionResult(false, "Invalid account or currency provided");
449  }
450
451  /**
452   * Used to add a certain amount of holdings to an identifier.
453   *
454   * @param identifier The identifier to use for the transaction.
455   * @param world      The world to use for the transaction.
456   * @param currency   The currency to use for the transaction.
457   * @param amount     The amount to add.
458   * @param pluginName The name of the plugin performing this transaction.
459   *
460   * @return The associated {@link TransactionResult result} from the transaction.
461   */
462  public TransactionResult addHoldings(final String identifier, final String world, final String currency, final BigDecimal amount, final String pluginName) {
463
464    final Optional<Account> account = TNECore.eco().account().findAccount(identifier);
465    final Optional<Currency> currencyOptional = TNECore.eco().currency().find(currency);
466
467    if(account.isPresent() && currencyOptional.isPresent()) {
468
469      final HoldingsModifier modifier = new HoldingsModifier(world,
470                                                             currencyOptional.get().getUid(),
471                                                             amount);
472
473      final Transaction transaction = new Transaction("give")
474              .to(account.get(), modifier)
475              .source(new PluginSource(pluginName));
476      try {
477
478        return transaction.process();
479
480      } catch(final InvalidTransactionException e) {
481        return new TransactionResult(false, e.getMessage());
482      }
483    }
484    return new TransactionResult(false, "Invalid account or currency provided");
485  }
486
487  /**
488   * Used to set the holdings of the specified identifier.
489   *
490   * @param identifier The identifier to set the holdings for.
491   * @param world      The world to use for setting the holdings.
492   * @param currency   The currency to use for setting the holdings
493   *
494   * @return True if the transactions was successful, otherwise false.
495   */
496  public boolean setHoldings(final String identifier, final String world, final String currency, final BigDecimal amount) {
497
498    final Optional<Account> account = TNECore.eco().account().findAccount(identifier);
499    final Optional<Currency> currencyOptional = TNECore.eco().currency().find(currency);
500
501    if(account.isPresent() && currencyOptional.isPresent()) {
502      return account.get().setHoldings(new HoldingsEntry(world, currencyOptional.get().getUid(), amount, EconomyManager.NORMAL));
503    }
504    return false;
505  }
506}
